snippet.textOriginal: I am exploring on timestamps in my livestreams and you created an easy to follow tutorial and adding all its benefits helps.

Thanks, as always, for a video that gets right to the point and explains things clearly.  I see everywhere in the searches people looking for just this instruction on creating time-stamps and you're the one who provides the answer.
Thanks man!! This is exactly what I was looking for, and the fact that you explained things relating to timestamps was an excellent bonus! Keep doing your thing!

Thank you Derral for sharing this quick tip and explaining why it is helpful for both viewers but also the channel.  I'm putting up my first time coded video tonight and I'll be curious about how it shows on the analytics.
Wow! Learning about this time stamp hyperlink is so awesome. Who would've known they were so easy to do. My very first YouTube video was soooo long, and it will be great to apply these to it.

I have used time stamps quite a lot for music videos that I uploaded that were so long that it contained multiple songs. YouTubers can then click on the time stamp itself and be automatically redirected to the point in the video where the song those users want to listen to without having a tedious find on scrolling back and forward in the video to find that particular song. Time stamps are mostly useful for music and song videos. However, I do agree with Derral Eves that time stamps can be used for other purposes such as discussion videos like this one here where Derral discusses about adding time stamps to your YouTube videos.
It's ironic that this tutorial on timestamps needs a timestamp more than anything.
This is a great idea for longer hangouts. Who would have thought it would be so easy! Thanks Derral !!
Straightforward and easy to follow. Thanks for the tutorial.
what syntax is used for video segments (start to finish) , using timestamp hyperlinks? for example a segment from 0:10 through 0:35

Derral Eves I am a fairly new subscriber and have spent hours watching your tips and tutorials. I love them. LOVE the timestamp trick. I've never used it but definitely will so people can skip between hauls directly to DIYs etc. It's SO easy, I'm still working and learning more and more each day. Oh this is what I got: Well loyal subscribers I actually videos youtube loves ejohn for my youtube voodoo subscription all not bad trust me ejohn

Thank you very easy to understand, I've been considering adding timestamps because I do a pro wrestling podcast and wanted people to be able to jump to certain parts of the show I'm talking about if they so choose.
Man, I appreciate this so much!  I swear; it’s the little things in life...

We started using that on our music classes, but Im doing with annotations and not on the description. Our classes have now 4 different topics (Introduction, theory, music, closing) so I made 4 buttons in the video and added annotations with the timestamp. If they want to watch the theory or the music again, they just have to click the button.
Thanks so much, short and sweet!  Straight to the point.  Totally answered my question.

I use this extensively in my long videos on my channel. 😊

In the description & as well as in a standalone pinned post/comment on my every video.

I call it Video Chapter List Guide. 😆
Simple but yet effective. Thanks for showing us how to do this. Cheers
This was really helpful! Thank you. It's a wonderful explantation in a short amount of time.
Hey Derral loving the videos! Keep them coming! I have a question though. How can you see your most engaged fans!? I cannot find out how...or maybe I don't have any!?:)  #QuestionsforDerral

Hi Darrel - I've used the time stamp techniques in many of our longer videos to help get people to the content they are looking for. Do you know if Youtube still counts the time stamp links (in description) and time stamp annotations as more than 1 view?
I am exploring on timestamps in my livestreams and you created an easy to follow tutorial and adding all its benefits helps.
